trans-unit.source: Provides a synchronization context for Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).

If a <xref:System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher> is not specified at the creation of the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext> instance, the current <xref:System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher> is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext>.
XAML Text Usage
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref> class by using the current <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref> class by using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher"></xref> to associate this <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref> with.
dispatcher is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref> class by using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher"></xref> to associate this <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref> with.
The priority used to send and post callback methods.
Creates a copy of this <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref>.
The copy of this synchronization context.
Invokes the callback in the synchronization context asynchronously.
The delegate is put in the dispatcher queue at a priority of <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority.Normal>.
<xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext.Post%2A> starts an asynchronous request to post a message.
The delegate to call.
The object passed to the delegate.
d is `null`.
Invokes the callback in the synchronization context synchronously.
The delegate is put in the dispatcher queue at a priority of <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority.Normal>.
The delegate to call.
The object passed to the delegate.
d is `null`.
Waits for any or all the elements in the specified array to receive a signal.
An array that contains the native operating system handles.
`true` to wait for all handles; `false` to wait for any handle.
The number of milliseconds to wait, or <xref href="System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite"></xref> (-1) to wait indefinitely.
The array index of the object that satisfied the wait.
